description.narrative: Two objectives: 1. Support the social protection knowledge generation and policy analysis in MENA (scope: all MENA countries); 2. Provide on-going on-line technical support to UNICEF Country Offices in MENARO (scope: 10 MENA countries).

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.A detailed technical project regarding the technical specifies of each of the four studies that will be developed for the support to social protection knowledge generation. A series of four documents are drafted as follows: 1.1 "Overview of social protection programmes in MENA from a Child and Equity Lens" published; 1.2 "Public Financing for Child-Sensitive Social Protection in MENA: what is yet needed to expand child-sensitive and equitable social protection?"published; 1.3 "Social Protection Legislative frameworks in MENA from a Child-Rights Perspective"published; 1.4 "Building shock-resistant national social protection systems" published.
1.B A series of webinars are delivered over the span of 2017 on the topics covered in the four documents as follows: 1.1 Webinar 1: "Overview of social protection programmes in MENA from a Child and Equity Lens" conducted 1.2 Webinar 2: "Public Financing for Child-Sensitive Social Protection in MENA: what is yet needed to expand child-sensitive and equitable social protection?"conducted 1.3 Webinar 3: "Social Protection Legislative frameworks in MENA from a Child-Rights Perspective" conducted 1.4 Webinar 4: "Building shock-resistant national social protection systems"conducted 1.5 Webinar 5: “The role of Zakat in the provision of social protection” conducted 1.6 Webinar 6: “No excuses: filling the evidence gap on social assistance in humanitarian settings” conducted 1.7 Webinar 7: Public Financing for Child-Sensitive Social Protection in MENA: what is yet needed to expand child-sensitive and equitable social protection? conducted
2. Provide ongoing support to 20 countries 2.1 Regular follow-up on-line meetings and one compiled document with information on country-level support (as annual reports); 2.2 A comprehensive compiled document on country-level support for future lessons learned and knowledge sharing.

comment.narrative: 1. Need for support on social protection knowledge generation and policy analysis in MENA (scope: all MENA countries); 2. Need for Country Office technical support focusing initially on: Morocco, Tunisia, Algeria, Egypt, Oman, Djibouti, Palestine, Jordan, Lebanon, and Yemen. As per the project`s Amendments, the online and remote assistance to 10 countries have been expanded to on site support in all 20 countries in the MENA region (Algeria, Bahrain, Djibouti, Egypt, Iran, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Palestine, Sudan, Syria, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates and Yemen).

1.A 1.3 Social Protection Legislative frameworks in MENA from a Child-Rights Perspective published; 1.B 1.7 Webinar 7: Public Financing for Child-Sensitive Social Protection in MENA: what is yet needed to expand child-sensitive and equitable social protection?
2. Provide ongoing support to 20 countries

1.A 1.3 Social Protection Legislative frameworks in MENA from a Child-Rights Perspective - ONGOING 1.B 1.7 Webinar 7: Public Financing for Child-Sensitive Social Protection in MENA: what is yet needed to expand child-sensitive and equitable social protection? Planned 24 October 2019 2. UNICEF Regional Social Protection Network Meeting Location & Date: Amman, March 10-11, 2019. Scope of activities: Development of 3 presentations. i. IPC presentation #1: Support to Knowledge Generation on Social protection in the MENA region (Fabio Veras Soares) ii. IPC presentation #2: Fiscal space for child-sensitive social protection for the MENA region (Carolina Bloch) iii. IPC presentation #3: The role of social protection in young people’s transition to the workplace in MENA (Fabio Veras Soares) .iv. Country-mission for two researchers to Jordan to participate in the meeting Deliverables: please access the link to all presentations on the following link. 2. Technical Assistance to UNICEF Country Office in Sudan – Phase 2 Location & Date: Brasilia and Khartoum, March – December 2019. i. Assessment of document ‘Support required by UNICEF Sudan’, shared by UNICEF MENARO Date: delivered to UNICEF MENARO and UNICEF Sudan March 11, 2019.
ii. Technical support on child and shock sensitive indicators Date: requested 26 March 2019; delivered to UNICEF Sudan April 2, 2019.
iii. List of activities for country-mission I Date: delivered to UNICEF Sudan April 16, 2019.
iv. Summary of WFP actions and operation in Sudan Date: delivered to UNICEF Sudan May 31, 2019.
v. Technical support on social protection coordination mechanisms Date: requested June 26, 2019; to be delivered to UNICEF Sudan by July 12, 2019.
vi. Social Protection Mapping – Validation Meetings and Elaboration Final Report In Progress
vii. Mission UNICEF Sudan – September 2019 September 15 to 19 2019 3. Development knowledge product ‘The Role of Social Protection in Young People’s Transition to the Workplace (YPTW) in MENA’ Location & Date: Brasilia and Amman, March to December 2019. Status: In progress i. Development of Report ‘The Role of Social Protection in Young People’s Transition to the Workplace (YPTW) in MENA’ (forthcoming)
iii.ii. Preparation and realization of Webinar (forthcoming)
iv.iii. Participation on a conference to present research findings (forthcoming)
4. Technical Assistance to UNICEF Tunisia country-office Location & Date: Brasilia, April 2019. Scope of activities: peer review of the report ‘Coût, impact et financement de l’allocation pour enfants en Tunisie – Rapport provisoire’, developed by Oxford Policy Management (OPM).
Technical support to Iran, Tunisia and Sudan.
Technical support to Iran, Tunisia and Sudan provided.
